channel.title: Windows Live Movie Maker
channel.description:
How do I install this on a Windows 7 machine which has no internet connection?
My desktop is sitting in my room, which is on the other side of the house. It has no wifi and we have no cable long enough to reach it. It has no functional DVD player in it but it has 2GB DDR2 800 ram and an 8600GT video card, so it is capable of video editing.
It has just been sitting there for the last 2 years getting barely used so I guess now is the time to put it to use. But anywho, I downloaded the wlsetup-web.exe on my netbook (Ubuntu) to copy to my desktop install Windows Live, but it is only 1.6Mb which means that it could not possibly contain all of the data required without some sort of magical compression system that I have never heard of.
So, is there any way that I can download a full installer of WLMM?
Thanks.
EDIT:
If anyone could just rar up their copy and put the registry files into the rar and upload it, that could also work unless computers have changed since I last used Windows..
EDIT2: I have downloaded a 135Mb file which I believe is safe (Scanned with ClamTK) I will try install it now.
EDIT3: It turns out that windows movie maker has really degraded since windows xp, any suggestions for a decent movie maker?

item.title: Windows Live Movie Maker
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:9, topic:422662”]shrug

works fine for the tasks its meant for[/quote]No, it doesnt even do that right. Have fun with the headache of adding an audio source to images. Hint: It sets image time to 3 seconds and crops the song. To get it right you have to manually enter numbers for the fkn image to sync with the audio time. The timeline editor is a huge pile of wank too and never reacts they way you expect it to.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows Live Movie Maker
item.dc:creator: @classic mopmans little slave
item.description:
@classic wrote:

[quote=“t4, post:10, topic:422662”]http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Camtasia_Studio

Free trial, pay to use (or acquire it by other means).[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Windows Live Movie Maker
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

en.wikipedia.org

Camtasia

Camtasia ( /kæmˈteɪʒə/) (formerly Camtasia Studio) is a software suite, created and published by TechSmith, for creating video tutorials and presentations directly via screencast, or via a direct recording plug-in to Microsoft PowerPoint. The screen area to be recorded can be chosen freely, and audio or other multimedia recordings may be recorded at the same time or added separately from any other source and integrated in the Camtasia component of the product. Both versions of Camtasia started as...

Free trial, pay to use (or acquire it by other means).

Read full topic

@runescape3dude wrote:

Yeah, I already got WLMM going last night. Played with it for 30 seconds and decided it was crap, made for 5 year olds by the look of it.

item.title: Windows Live Movie Maker

item.description:

http://windowslivehelp.com/solution.aspx?solutionid=61168194-26aa-4ce6-910a-aeb36fc89d17

But really I’d recommend using another editor. AE isn’t really what you want, though…

item.title: Windows Live Movie Maker
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

Teh Spede:

what about PHYSICALLY moving the pc so that you can install it

It has no sides on it and one of the hard disks only has one screw in it and the CMOS battery is dead which would mean that I would need to reconfigure the bios after moving it an I am lazy. I reckon I might just pirate a copy of after effects and use a USB stick to copy it over.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows Live Movie Maker
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

The thing is that that computer has hardware which is pretty much incompatible with Linux (and Mac OSX) - it refuses to boot no matter what BIOS settings you use for some reason (M2V-MX). Also, networking cables are quite messy and we don’t want to go around drilling holes through the walls/floor/ceiling to put a cable in. So it is pretty much just Windows being the only option.

And I don’t really want to pirate a copy of XP seeing how you can get in the shit quite easily for that in NZ.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows Live Movie Maker
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

There are probably multiple free ones you could get for Ubuntu.

Also, you seriously can’t go to a local store and buy a 100ft Cat5e cable for $15 or less?

Read full topic
